Title:
Luteoporia albomarginata gen. et sp. nov. (Meruliaceae,
Basidiomycota) from tropical China
Abstract:
Luteoporia is proposed as a new genus in Polyporales based
on morphological characters and molecular data. The genus is typified by
L. albomarginata sp. nov. which is characterized by an annual growth
habit, resupinate basidiocarps with yellow pores, a monomitic hyphal
system with clamp connections, tramal hyphae with swollen tips which
projecting out of hymenium, and hyaline, thin-walled, oblong-ellipsoid
basidiospores. Phylogeny of L. albomarginata and its related species was
inferred from ITS and nLSU rDNA sequences, and the genus belongs to the
Meruliaceae.
